title: Worked Solution
text: To determine whether the value $$y=\frac{3}{5}$$ is a solution to the equation $$5y+3=10y-4$$, we can substitute $$\frac{3}{5}$$ for $$y$$ in the equation and see if it results in a true statement. Substituting $$\frac{3}{5}$$ for $$y$$ in the equation $$5y+3=10y-4$$ gives us: $$5\left(\frac{3}{5}\right)+3=\operatorname{10}\left(\frac{3}{5}\right)-4$$ This simplifies to: $$3+3=6-4$$ Which simplifies to: $$6=2$$ This is not a true statement, so $$y=\frac{3}{5}$$ is not a solution to the equation $$5y+3=10y-4$$.
